[p] [b]Depression reduction[/b] is the experience of minimizing the symptoms associated with [int-link to="/effects/depression"]depression[/int-link] and low mood states. It is distinct from effects such as cognitive euphoria, as it does not simply elevate the user's mood but instead results in a sense of stable emotional well-being. [/p]

[p] Depression reduction most commonly occurs with adequate nutritional intake.[ref to="1" no="1" /][ref to="2" no="1" /][ref to="3" no="1" /][ref to="4" no="1" /][ref to="5" no="1" /]Severe depression is effectively reduced with conventional antidepressants; although in mild to moderate depression, SSRI's and tricyclic antidepressants appear (on average) to be either only minimally helpful or completely ineffective.[ref to="6" no="1" /]However, depression reduction can also occur under the influence of hormone replacement therapies[ref to="7" no="1" /]and modafinil.[ref to="8" no="1" /] [/p]

[h3] Euthymia [/h3]

[p]Euthymia (semantically the opposite of [int-link to="/effects/depression/"]dysthymia[/int-link]) is a long-lasting and self‐sustaining experience of stable emotional well-being. This state is characterized by:[ref to="9" no="1" /] [/p]

[ul]
 [li] A lack disordered mood in patients with prior clinically diagnosed mood disorders; if sadness/anxiety/irritability are experienced they are short-lived and do not significantly impact everyday life. [/li]
 [li] Feeling cheerful, calm, active, and interested in things. [/li]
 [li] Possessing cognitive flexibility. [/li]
 [li] Sleep is refreshing or restorative. [/li]
 [li] A unifying outlook on life which guides actions and feelings to shape the future. [/li]
 [li] Being resistant to stress (resilience and anxiety or frustration tolerance). [/li]
[/ul]

[p] It is worth noting that this is unlikely to be an isolated effect component but rather the result of combining an appropriate environment with other coinciding effects such as [int-link to="/effects/rejuvenation"]rejuvenation[/int-link], [int-link to="/effects/introspection"]introspection[/int-link], [int-link to="/effects/personal-bias-suppression"]personal bias suppression[/int-link], and [int-link to="/effects/spirituality-enhancement"]spirituality enhancement[/int-link]. In many cases, it may also stem from the direct neurological changes that occur as a result of a substances’ pharmacological action. [/p]

[p] Euthymia most commonly occurs at varying levels of efficacy under the influence of a range of different substances, primarily [int-link to="/summaries/psychedelics/cognitive"]psychedelics[/int-link] in combination with [int-link to="/effects/psychedelic-therapy/"]psychotherapy[/int-link],[ref to="30" /][ref to="31" /] or [int-link to="/summaries/dissociatives"]dissociatives[/int-link].[ref to="26" /] However, it can also occur throughout the course of prescribed psychiatric medications and under the influence of certain entactogens. [/p]

Depression reduction is the experience of minimizing the symptoms associated with depression and low mood states. It most commonly occurs at varying levels of efficacy under the influence of a range of different substances, primarily psychedelics in combination with psychotherapy, or dissociatives.

[p] A 2021 meta analysis examined 12 double-blind randomized controlled trials for classical psychedelics treating depressive symptoms.[ref to="30" /] A single-dose [i]in combination with a psychotherapy treatment program[/i] created moderate to large reductions in negative mood symptoms. This reduction remained consistent at several intervals throughout the examined time-frame of 3 hours to 60 days; there were simply not enough randomized clinical trials to extend their timeframe. This effect was present in both healthy and disordered patients. [/p]

[p] A 2020 meta analysis examined 9 placebo-controlled studies for psychedelic psychotherapy.[ref to="31" /] The studies had one to three doses [i]in combination with a psychotherapy treatment program[/i] and results were measured several times over the course of 6 months. The authors' effect size indicated an 80% probability that a randomly selected patient receiving psychedelic psychotherapy outperforms a patient receiving placebo. Additionally, there were no incidents of severe adverse effects. The authors even compared their results to other meta analyses examining "gold standard" treatments for several mental health problems: psychedelic psychotherapy greatly outperformed. [/p]

[p] Psychotherapy with 1-3 doses of a classical psychedelic greatly outperforms current pharmacological standards in regards to producing a depression reduction all while having minimal to no adverse effects. The benefits of only needing a single dose over the course of 6 months as opposed to a daily administration of a substance incurring larger side effects and not producing desired effects until the 2-4 week mark appear obvious. [/p]

[h3] Immediate Relief [/h3]

[p] [b]Scheduling activities[/b] is a behavioral treatment for depression that appears as effective as other psychological or pharmacological treatments.[ref to="10" /] There is a significant relationship between mood and the number of pleasant activities engaged in. Depressed individuals find fewer activities pleasant, engage in pleasant activities less frequently, and obtain less positive reinforcement. [/p]

[p] [b]Exercise[/b] is an evidence-based treatment for depression.[ref to="11" /][ref to="12" /][ref to="13" /][ref to="14" /][ref to="23" /] It also has the advantage of preventing the increased risk of drug-drug interactions. Moderate to heavy exercise of any type (including yoga) appears as effective, and do not significantly differ from, other pure forms of depression treatment such as psychotherapy or pharmacological treatment. Large changes in fitness do not appear necessary either. [/p]

[h2]Ketamine and its isomers[/h2]

[p][b] WARNING [/b] [ref to="27" /][ref to="28" /]- Ketamine possesses a strong abuse potential at typical antidepressive doses. Ketamine has reported cases of severe bladder and liver injury. Esketamine, a newer nasal spray formulation of Ketamine, does not have any reported cases and is purported to have a better safety profile. However, in recent short-term clinical trials esketamine still more-than-doubled the amount of adverse bladder events when compared to placebo (6-10% vs 1-4%).  Although 2/3 of esketamine incidents resolved themselves either without intervention or through a lowering of dosage, any physiological damage is acute and immediate: in typical dose regimens steady-state concentrations are not reached. [/p]

[p]Ketamine offers a (dose-dependent) large immediate depression reduction for 30-50% of patients; its effect-sizes become moderate to small by day 7.[ref to="24" /][ref to="25" /][ref to="29" /] Weekly to biweekly dosing maintains a statistically significant depression reduction measured at Day 28 and repeated administration has resulted in cases of euthymia.[ref to="26" /][ref to="28" /] A family history of alcohol-use-disorder in a first-degree relative is associated with an improved antidepressive response, and a reduction of adverse mental effects such as [int-link to="/effects/cognitive-dysphoria"]dysphoria[/int-link]. Its antidepressant properties may also stem more generally from dissociatives' [int-link to="/effects/novelty-enhancement"]novelty[/int-link] and/or [int-link to="/effects/immersion-enhancement"]immersion enhancements[/int-link]. [/p]

[h3] Long-term [/h3]

[p]Refer to the generalizable behavioral therapy mechanisms described the [int-link to="/effects/psychedelic-therapy/"]Psychedelic Therapy[/int-link] article. [/p]

[p]There is no doubt Cognitive Behavioral Therapy is an effective treatment for adult depression.[ref to="15" /] There are no large differences in efficacy between major psychotherapies for mild to moderate depression.[ref to="16" /] There is also a large body of evidence supporting computerized care, and psychoeducational interventions.[ref to="17" /][ref to="18" /][ref to="19" /][ref to="20" /][ref to="21" /] [/p]

[p] For patients with mild or moderate depression in natural settings, antidepressant relapse rate is high. Behavioral therapy may prevent relapses in the long-term.[ref to="22" /] [/p]

It is distinct from effects such as cognitive euphoria, as it does not simply elevate the user's mood but instead results in a sense of stable emotional well-being. "]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":[" Depression reduction most commonly occurs with adequate nutritional intake.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"1","no":"1"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"2","no":"1"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"3","no":"1"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"4","no":"1"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"5","no":"1"}},"Severe depression is effectively reduced with conventional antidepressants; although in mild to moderate depression, SSRI's and tricyclic antidepressants appear (on average) to be either only minimally helpful or completely ineffective.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"6","no":"1"}},"However, depression reduction can also occur under the influence of hormone replacement therapies",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"7","no":"1"}},"and modafinil.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"8","no":"1"}}," "]},"

",{"name":"toc","properties":{}},"

",{"name":"hr","properties":{}},"

",{"name":"h2","properties":{"id":"euthymia"},"children":[" Euthymia "]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":[{"name":"i","properties":{},"children":["Euthymia"]}," (semantically the opposite of ",{"name":"int-link","properties":{"to":"/effects/depression/"},"children":["dysthymia"]},") is a long-lasting and self‐sustaining experience of stable emotional well-being. This state is characterized by:",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"9","no":"1"}}," "]},"

",{"name":"ul","properties":{},"children":["
 ",{"name":"li","properties":{},"children":[" A lack disordered mood in patients with prior clinically diagnosed mood disorders; if sadness/anxiety/irritability are experienced they are short-lived and do not significantly impact everyday life. "]},"
 ",{"name":"li","properties":{},"children":[" Feeling cheerful, calm, active, and interested in things. "]},"
 ",{"name":"li","properties":{},"children":[" Possessing cognitive flexibility. "]},"
 ",{"name":"li","properties":{},"children":[" Sleep is refreshing or restorative. "]},"
 ",{"name":"li","properties":{},"children":[" A unifying outlook on life which guides actions and feelings to shape the future. "]},"
 ",{"name":"li","properties":{},"children":[" Being resistant to stress (resilience and anxiety or frustration tolerance). "]},"
"]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":[" It is worth noting that this is unlikely to be an isolated effect component but rather the result of combining an appropriate environment with other coinciding effects such as ",{"name":"int-link","properties":{"to":"/effects/rejuvenation"},"children":["rejuvenation"]},", ",{"name":"int-link","properties":{"to":"/effects/introspection"},"children":["introspection"]},", ",{"name":"int-link","properties":{"to":"/effects/personal-bias-suppression"},"children":["personal bias suppression"]},", and ",{"name":"int-link","properties":{"to":"/effects/spirituality-enhancement"},"children":["spirituality enhancement"]},". In many cases, it may also stem from the direct neurological changes that occur as a result of a substances’ pharmacological action. "]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":[" Euthymia most commonly occurs at varying levels of efficacy under the influence of a range of different substances, primarily ",{"name":"int-link","properties":{"to":"/summaries/psychedelics/cognitive"},"children":["psychedelics"]}," in combination with psychotherapy",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"30"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"31"}},", or ",{"name":"int-link","properties":{"to":"/summaries/dissociatives"},"children":["dissociatives"]},".",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"26"}}," However, it can also occur throughout the course of prescribed psychiatric medications and under the influence of certain entactogens. "]},"

",{"name":"hr","properties":{}},"

",{"name":"h2","properties":{"id":"analysis"},"children":["Analysis"]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":[" A 2021 meta analysis examined 12 double-blind randomized controlled trials for classical psychedelics treating depressive symptoms.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"30"}}," A single-dose ",{"name":"i","properties":{},"children":["in combination with a psychotherapy treatment program"]}," created moderate to large reductions in negative mood symptoms. This reduction remained consistent at several intervals throughout the examined time-frame of 3 hours to 60 days; there were simply not enough randomized clinical trials to extend their timeframe. This effect was present in both healthy and disordered patients. "]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":[" A 2020 meta analysis examined 9 placebo-controlled studies for psychedelic psychotherapy.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"31"}}," The studies had one to three doses ",{"name":"i","properties":{},"children":["in combination with a psychotherapy treatment program"]}," and results were measured several times over the course of 6 months. The authors' effect size indicated an 80% probability that a randomly selected patient receiving psychedelic psychotherapy outperforms a patient receiving placebo. Additionally, there were no incidents of severe adverse effects. The authors even compared their results to other meta analyses examining "gold standard" treatments for several mental health problems: psychedelic psychotherapy greatly outperformed. "]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":[" Psychotherapy with 1-3 doses of a classical psychedelic greatly outperforms current pharmacological standards in regards to producing a depression reduction all while having minimal to no adverse effects. The benefits of only needing a single dose over the course of 6 months as opposed to a daily administration of a substance incurring larger side effects and not producing desired effects until the 2-4 week mark appear obvious. "]},"

",{"name":"h3","properties":{"id":"immediate-relief"},"children":[" Immediate Relief "]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":[" ",{"name":"i","properties":{},"children":["Scheduling activities"]}," is a behavioral treatment for depression that appears as effective as other psychological or pharmacological treatments.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"10"}}," There is a significant relationship between mood and the number of pleasant activities engaged in. Depressed individuals find fewer activities pleasant, engage in pleasant activities less frequently, and obtain less positive reinforcement. "]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":[" ",{"name":"i","properties":{},"children":["Exercise"]}," is an evidence-based treatment for depression.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"11"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"12"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"13"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"14"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"23"}}," It also has the advantage of preventing the increased risk of drug-drug interactions. Moderate to heavy exercise of any type (including yoga) appears as effective, and do not significantly differ from, other pure forms of depression treatment such as psychotherapy or pharmacological treatment. Large changes in fitness do not appear necessary either. "]},"

",{"name":"hr","properties":{}},"

",{"name":"h2","properties":{"id":"ketamine-and-its-isomers"},"children":["Ketamine and its isomers"]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":[{"name":"i","properties":{},"children":[" WARNING "]}," ",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"27"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"28"}},"- Ketamine possesses a strong abuse potential at typical antidepressive doses. Ketamine has reported cases of severe bladder and liver injury. Esketamine, a newer nasal spray formulation of Ketamine, does not have any reported cases and is purported to have a better safety profile. However, in recent short-term clinical trials esketamine still more-than-doubled the amount of adverse bladder events when compared to placebo (6-10% vs 1-4%).  Although 2/3 of esketamine incidents resolved themselves either without intervention or through a lowering of dosage, any physiological damage is acute and immediate: in typical dose regimens steady-state concentrations are not reached. "]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":["Ketamine offers a (dose-dependent) large immediate depression reduction for 30-50% of patients; its effect-sizes become moderate to small by day 7.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"24"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"25"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"29"}}," Weekly to biweekly dosing maintains a statistically significant depression reduction measured at Day 28 and repeated administration has resulted in cases of euthymia.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"26"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"28"}}," A family history of alcohol-use-disorder in a first-degree relative is associated with an improved antidepressive response, and a reduction of adverse mental effects such as ",{"name":"int-link","properties":{"to":"/effects/cognitive-dysphoria"},"children":["dysphoria"]},". Its antidepressant properties may also stem more generally from dissociatives' ",{"name":"int-link","properties":{"to":"/effects/novelty-enhancement"},"children":["novelty"]}," and/or ",{"name":"int-link","properties":{"to":"/effects/immersion-enhancement"},"children":["immersion enhancements"]},". "]},"

",{"name":"h3","properties":{"id":"ketamine-long-term"},"children":[" Long-term "]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":["There is no doubt Cognitive Behavioral Therapy is an effective treatment for adult depression.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"15"}}," There are no large differences in efficacy between major psychotherapies for mild to moderate depression.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"16"}}," There is also a large body of evidence supporting computerized care, and psychoeducational interventions.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"17"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"18"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"19"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"20"}},{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"21"}}," "]},"

",{"name":"p","properties":{},"children":[" For patients with mild or moderate depression in natural settings, antidepressant relapse rate is high. Behavioral therapy may prevent relapses in the long-term.",{"name":"ref","properties":{"to":"22"}}," "]},"

"]
